title: Iola Leroy, or Shadows Uplifted
excerpt: It was a bright spring morning when Iola Leroy looked from the car window and watched the ever-changing landscape...

title: Bury Me in a Free Land
excerpt: Make me a grave where’er you will, / In a lowly plain or a lofty hill...

title: The New Negro: An Interpretation
excerpt: Harlem has become in a way a spiritual capital of Negro life. In Harlem, Negro life is seizing upon its first chances for group expression and self-determination...

title: Mules and Men
excerpt: I was glad when somebody told me, 'You may go and collect Negro folklore.'

title: The Basis of the Supreme Court's Decision Against Segregation
excerpt: The Court concluded that in the field of public education, the doctrine of 'separate but equal' has no place...

title: The Crisis
excerpt: The Crisis, edited initially by W.E.B. Du Bois, served as the official magazine of the NAACP, advocating for civil rights, political equality, and cultural expression.

title: The Souls of Black Folk
excerpt: One ever feels his two-ness,—an American, a Negro; two souls, two thoughts, two unreconciled strivings...

title: Montage of a Dream Deferred
excerpt: What happens to a dream deferred? Does it dry up like a raisin in the sun?

title: The Negro Speaks of Rivers
excerpt: I've known rivers ancient as the world and older than the flow of human blood in human veins...

title: Their Eyes Were Watching God
excerpt: Ships at a distance have every man's wish on board.

title: Invisible Man
excerpt: I am invisible, understand, simply because people refuse to see me.
